title: Continuous Integration / Continuous Deliver (CI/CD)
description: CI/CD bridges the gaps between development and operation activities and teams by enforcing automation in building, testing and deployment of applications.
key-ideas: Continuous Integration is the frequent (i.e. daily or multiple times per day) merger of small, independent feature code changes back into the main code base.
Continous Delivery is the frequent (i.e. daily or multiple times per day) re-building and deployment of code changes accepted into the main repository.
CI/CD is a core part of Agile software development practices.
CI/CD is frequently associated with the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC).
CI/CD is typically directly associated with a DevOps pipeline.
CI automates mergers, building, and testing.
Continous Deployment (rather than delivery) automatically deploys to production.
